inventory.commentary: 28nov06 update wn2.1, added features. ahouston 28nov06 merged senses 1 and 2. ahouston

sense.name: significant discovery or new Insight
sense.commentary: BREAKTHROUGH[+event][+discovery][+significant][+insight] Any kind of productive insight or new understanding.
sense.examples: Computer scientists have made a breakthrough in JPEG compression. New breakthroughs in medicine are happening every day. John had a spiritual breakthrough and converted to Zen Buddhism. Cold fusion turned out not to be the breakthrough its advocates had declared it to be.

sense.name: penetration of a barrier or obstacle
sense.commentary: BREAKTHROUGH[+event][+penetration][+barrier] The penetration of some barrier, either physical or social
sense.examples: The breakthrough of the enemy's gates occurred after a prolonged assault. The labor union's concession on pay was a key breakthrough for the negotiations. This novel was her real breakthrough into the New York literary scene.
